main event: A round brilliant object was observed like a bright star in Monroe, Wisconsin on 29 March 1960, moving close overhead and then passing out.
interesting points: The object was described as bright and star-like in appearance., It was observed for a duration of 2 minutes., There are comments suggesting that the object might have been a balloon due to its behavior., The sighting was reported by Capt. Stephen M. Flanagan, USAF., There was no correlation found with known air traffic at the time of the sighting.
sighted object: round brilliant object like a bright star
witness description: L.R. Rambler, Night Watchman, former Air Force Sergeant
